alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 5:50PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Central Ohio, Fairfield and Hocking. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 549 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen recently on the wet soils. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hide-A-Way Hills, Amanda, Stoutsville, Sugar Grove, Clearport, Rockbridge and Hideaway Hills.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
